profile.name: Greg Kroah-Hartman
profile.bio: Linux kernel dev & maintainer. USB, drivers, stable updates. Passionate about FOSS & low-level systems. Sharing code insights, occasional hot takes, and what I'm learning daily. 🐧⚙️

tweets.content: Simple, readable C code that does one thing well is infinitely preferable to overly clever, obfuscated 'optimized' code that breaks easily. Elegance is clarity. #CodeRefactoring #CProgramming

Exciting to see the progress with Rust in the kernel, but let's be pragmatic. C isn't going anywhere for the vast majority of existing code. It's an additive, not a replacement. #RustLang #Linux #Kernel
Reviewed a fantastic patch series for a new driver today. The quality of submissions keeps improving. This is what makes open source thrive! #OpenSource #LinuxKernel #Community
Still baffled by projects that re-implement basic linked list functionality instead of using existing kernel primitives. We have good reasons for those. #Linux #KernelDev #CProgramming
If your "cutting edge" build system takes longer to compile a simple `hello world` than my laptop takes to build an entire kernel, we need to talk. #DeveloperExperience #Tooling
Spent an hour tracking down a bug only to find it was a typo in a comment. The comment, not the code. I need more coffee. Or less sleep. Can't tell anymore. #DevHumor #Debugging
The sheer elegance of a perfectly crafted `struct` and its accompanying low-level helper functions often goes unappreciated. It's poetry in bytes. #CProgramming #KernelDev
Another week, another few hundred patches merged upstream. The pipeline never stops! Keeping the kernel healthy is a full-time job (and then some). #Linux #KernelMaintainer
Static analysis tools are invaluable, but they're a supplement, not a substitute, for careful human review and deep understanding of the code's intent. #CodeQuality #SoftwareEngineering
Seeing a lot of buzz about the new 'AI-powered code generation' tools. Interesting, but let's see how they handle kernel-level concurrency issues before we declare C dead. #TechNews #AI #Kernel
Diving deep into a new architecture's memory management unit spec this week. Always something new to learn, even after decades. The complexity is fascinating. #LearningInPublic #KernelDev #Hardware

Had a great discussion with a vendor about upstreaming their out-of-tree patches. Collaboration is key to ensuring long-term maintainability and stability for everyone. #OpenSource #Linux #Collaboration

Diving into some historical driver code today. Fascinating to see the evolution of approaches to hardware interaction over the decades. Lessons learned, forgotten, and relearned. #LinuxHistory #CodeArchaeology
My bug detector is mostly powered by caffeine and sheer stubbornness. And a debugger, sometimes. #Debugging #DevHumor
"It works on my machine" takes on a whole new meaning when "my machine" is a specific test rig running a custom kernel config on obscure hardware. #DevLife #KernelDev
Just wrapped up another round of stable kernel updates. Always satisfying to push fixes out to millions of users. On to the next batch! #Linux #KernelMaintainer #FOSS
Spent some time understanding the intricacies of page table walks on a new CPU architecture. The details under the hood are truly mind-boggling. #Architecture #CPU #MemoryManagement
Really impressed with a new contributor's first patch series. Clear communication, well-tested, and clean code. This is how new maintainers are born! #OpenSource #Community
